jobs.title: Prompt Engineer (M/W/NB)
jobs.description:
Company Description

Ubisoft is a global leader in gaming with teams across the world creating original and memorable gaming experiences, from Assassin‚Äôs Creed, Rainbow Six to Just Dance and more. We believe diverse perspectives help both players and teams thrive. If you‚Äôre passionate about innovation and pushing entertainment boundaries, join our journey and help us create the unknown!

Ubisoft's pioneering studio, Paris studio was responsible for the publisher's first successes following its creation in 1992. Today, it is at the helm of such must-have licenses as Just Dance, Ghost Recon and Mario + The Rabbids. Ubisoft Paris has also built a solid reputation as a partner of choice in cross-studio collaborations such as Watch Dogs, Skull & Bones, Beyond Good & Evil 2 and Star Wars. Building on this experience, the studio continues to push the boundaries of creativity by working on some very promising yet unannounced projects.

With 750 talents of 35 nationalities, Ubisoft Paris is today the largest studio in France and one of the most experienced in the industry. Young talents can benefit from the strong presence of senior profiles in the creative, technical or artistic fields. Everyone is driven by the same passion: to push the limits of what is possible and to offer new experiences to our players.

Ready to join the adventure? Join us at the Paris Studio!

Job Description

In this role, you‚Äôll join a team developing a tech product designed to integrate AI features into our games. Within our production studios, you‚Äôll work at the intersection of AI, design, and quality assurance teams‚Äîallowing you to bring your expertise in prompt engineering and AI to create unique gaming experiences.

As a Prompt Engineer (M/W/NB), your responsibilities will include:


Participating in the scoping and design of AI-driven game features;Ensuring the technology is accessible and usable by different departments;Guaranteeing prompt content consistency across environments by testing how changes impact performance (error correction, divergence detection, rewording and clarification), while aiming to optimize latency and cost;Helping define and promote best practices for prompt engineering and supporting teams in implementing them;Contributing to the creation of both manual and automated test scenarios in collaboration with QA and AI teams;Analyzing bugs and feedback, identifying those related to prompt content, and suggesting improvements;Helping identify and test new machine learning models, as well as designing tools to support their use;Staying up to date on the latest in prompt engineering and AI research.


Qualifications


Passionate about video games, with at least one prior experience in a tech company;Proven experience designing prompts for various tasks and across multiple providers. You‚Äôre familiar with concepts like agents and function calling, reasoning strategies, chain/tree of thought approaches, zero-shot & few-shot learning, and retrieval-augmented generation (RAG);Solid understanding of several language models (GPT-4, Gemini, Claude, Qwen, SentenceBERT, Llama, Mistral, etc.) and their key differences;Fluent in both English, written and spoken (French is a plus). You are also known for your strong writing skills;Strong listening and comprehension skills, with the ability to translate user needs into clear specifications;Capable of adapting your analysis and communication style to reach a wide range of stakeholders;Independent and curious by nature.


Bonus points for:


Programming skills (Python, C#, etc.) and experience working with AI APIs;Experience in narrative content creation (dialogue, quests, world-building) and/or role-playing games;A good understanding of video game design principles.


When reviewing applications, particular attention will be paid to the quality of the cover letter. We will favor a concise text that demonstrates a clear understanding of the position and highlights one or two well-targeted experiences and/or skills, rather than a long, generic letter that simply reiterates your r√©sum√©.

Additional Information

Joining us means having access from day one to:


Flexible working hours and the possibility to work remotely up to two days per week, in accordance with Ubisoft‚Äôs remote work policy;20 days of remote work per year from a European Union country (eligibility limited to EU citizens);Our internal e-learning platform to finally train on the tools you‚Äôve always wanted to master;Our game library where you can borrow the latest Ubisoft titles, competitor games, consoles, and board games;Our works council (CSE) offering discounted rates on a wide range of shows, cinemas, concerts, gyms, amusement parks, and many other great deals.


And after one year?


You‚Äôll have a career and development plan established with your manager, along with clear goals to help you grow each year;You‚Äôll have joined one of our clubs: choir, yoga, tennis, lightsaber‚Ä¶ or even created your own!You‚Äôll enjoy your 1.5-hour lunch break by taking a class in our gym or borrowing one of our bikes for a ride in the Bois de Vincennes;You‚Äôll be looking forward to the next surf/yoga or ski weekend organized by the CSE;You‚Äôll have become unbeatable at foosball, climbing, Just Dance, or Boomerang Fu;You‚Äôll have raided the internal sale to complete your collection of Ubisoft goodies and games (because you can never have too many).


Ubisoft is an equal opportunity employer and offers all individuals the same access to employment, regardless of gender, ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, social status, disability, or age. Ubisoft is committed to fostering an inclusive work environment that reflects the diversity of its player community.

Check out this guide to help you with your application, and learn about our actions to encourage more diversity and inclusion.

We're expanding our newly formed Redesign AI team to help small to mid-sized businesses adopt AI engine technologies.

You will focus on creating production-ready ETL processes using Apache Airflow, integrating with diverse data stores, and ensuring all code meets rigorous development standards, including peer review, scalability, and comprehensive test coverage. batch processing needs.Required Qualifications:Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field (or equivalent experience).5+ years of hands-on experience as a Data Engineer or implementation including comprehensive test coverage (e.g., using pytest or similar frameworks).Strong emphasis on software engineering practices: Experience with peer code reviews, version control (e.g., Git), and ensuring code is modular, documented, and scalable to prevent common pitfalls like brittle or unmaintainable pipelines.Familiarity with data modeling, transformation, and integration in distributed environments.Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.Preferred Qualifications:Experience with RAG pipelines, including vector databases and embedding techniques for AI-driven applications.Hands-on experience with databases such as PostgreSQL (for relational data), StarRocks (for analytical workloads), Cassandra or ScyllaDB (for high-throughput NoSQL), and Qdrant (for vector search).Knowledge of cloud data services (e.g., AWS Glue, Azure Data Factory) and orchestration tools beyond Airflow.Familiarity with monitoring and observability tools like Prometheus or OpenSearch for data pipeline health.Certifications in relevant technologies (e.g., Apache Airflow)

jobs.title: CRM Manager
jobs.description:
About EMF Media
EMF Media is a performance-driven brand studio specialised in e-commerce growth. We partner with high-potential brands to drive and sustain high-impact growth across paid media, influencer marketing, creative strategy, and CRM.Since 2020, we‚Äôve helped more than 50 brands accelerate their trajectory, managing over ‚Ç¨70 million in paid media spend, executing 25,000+ influencer activations, and generating over ‚Ç¨350 million in tracked revenue. In the last 12 months, we‚Äôve driven over ‚Ç¨80 million in sales across a focused portfolio of high-growth e-commerce businesses.
About the Role
The CRM Manager is a core player in EMF Media‚Äôs Retention & CRM team, owning the development, optimisation, and execution of email, SMS, and push marketing strategies across all lifecycle stages.His role blends performance marketing with automation strategy and creative collaboration to drive customer acquisition, repeat purchases, maximisation of lifetime value (LTV), and reduction of churn. You‚Äôll work cross-functionally with data analysts, creatives, performance teams, and lifecycle strategists to deliver highly personalised, high-impact campaigns at scale.
Key Responsibilities
1. CRM Strategy & ExecutionBuild, own, and evolve full-funnel CRM roadmaps for our e-commerce clients, ensuring lifecycle strategies are tailored to each brand‚Äôs growth stage, customer behaviours, and retention goals.
Manage the CRM content calendar in alignment with brand priorities and marketing campaigns.Lead the strategy and execution of automated lifecycle flows, ensuring each step is delivered by the right stakeholders (copy, design, dev) and aligned with performance goals.Oversee SMS and push notification strategies as complementary retention touchpoints.Align CRM and acquisition strategies to ensure journey continuity, while establishing and tracking performance KPIs across each client account.
2. Customer Segmentation & PersonalisationLeverage data to deliver the right message to the right user at the right time.
Define advanced segmentation strategies based on user behaviour, purchase patterns, and lifecycle stage.Implement AI-powered tools for dynamic content, personalised recommendations, and conditional logic.Continuously refine segments based on performance feedback and predictive models.Build scalable personalisation frameworks for email, SMS, and push notifications.
3. Performance Tracking & OptimisationLet performance insights drive your next iteration.
Track and optimise CRM KPIS to ensure they consistently meet performance goals and contribute to client account growth.Run structured A/B tests on subject lines, design, timing, and messaging.Build and maintain reporting dashboards for ongoing optimisation.Leverage insights to refine CRM strategy, align internal teams, and deliver clear reporting and strategic updates to clients.
4. Automation & Tech Stack ManagementBuild a smart, scalable, and reliable CRM infrastructure.
Create and manage flows in platforms like Klaviyo.Ensure clean integrations between CRM, and analytics environments.Implement predictive send times, AI-driven product blocks, and custom event triggers.Maintain compliance, deliverability, and responsiveness across all devices and inboxes.
5. Cross-Team Collaboration & Creative BriefingOperate as the connector between content, strategy, and execution.
Collaborate with Copywriters and Designers to produce high-converting, brand-aligned content.Own the briefing process for CRM assets and campaign messaging.Sync with Performance Managers to align CRM goals with launch calendars and growth pushes.Support ecommerce and retention strategies with customer-first storytelling and dynamic loyalty messaging.
Ideal Candidate Profile
3‚Äì5 years of experience in CRM, lifecycle marketing, or retention strategy within a DTC or e-commerce environment.If from a brand-side background, the company must have generated between ‚Ç¨1M and ‚Ç¨50M in annual revenue, ideally with high growth velocity.Proven hands-on experience with platforms like Klaviyo or similar CRM tools.Strong understanding of customer segmentation, automated lifecycle flows, and email/SMS strategy focused on performance.An analytical mindset with the ability to extract actionable insights from data and continuously improve results.Comfortable managing CRM campaigns end-to-end, from planning and execution to testing and reporting.Strong project management and cross-functional communication skills, especially with creative and performance marketing teams.Experience working with wellness, beauty, or lifestyle brands is mandatory.

What We Offer
Join a High-Performance TeamBe part of a fast-growing and impact-driven agency, working alongside top-tier talent focused on results.Remote & Flexible WorkWork from anywhere in France while connecting with a collaborative, high-energy team.Career Growth & LearningAccess continuous opportunities to expand your expertise, take on new responsibilities, and accelerate your career trajectory.Collaborative CultureBe part of a team that values efficiency, transparency, and shared success, where everyone contributes to collective performance.Competitive CompensationReceive a salary that reflects your skills and experience, complemented by performance-based bonuses.
Our Recruitment Process
Our hiring process is designed to assess both strategic depth and operational excellence, ensuring a strong mutual fit from day one.
Initial ApplicationA short form to understand your background, mindset, and creative approach. HR InterviewA 30-minute conversation focused on your career path, role expectations, and fit with our mission. Technical InterviewA 60-minute deep dive with your future manager, including a live technical test to assess your creative frameworks, processes, and real-time decision-making. The SprintA 4 week, part-time collaboration with the team you may join.The Sprint helps both sides validate real-world collaboration before moving forward. Leadership InterviewA final strategic discussion with the COO or CEO to ensure vision alignment and long-term fit, after the Sprint. Offer & OnboardingIf everything aligns, we‚Äôll extend a formal offer and begin onboarding.

Vinted is the leading second-hand fashion marketplace in Europe and a go-to destination for all kinds of second-hand items. jobs.title: Growth Marketing - Stripe Publishing
jobs.description:
Who we are

About Stripe

Stripe is a financial infrastructure platform for businesses. Millions of companies - from the world‚Äôs largest enterprises to the most ambitious startups - use Stripe to accept payments, grow their revenue, and accelerate new business opportunities. Our mission is to increase the GDP of the internet, and we have a staggering amount of work ahead. That means you have an unprecedented opportunity to put the global economy within everyone's reach while doing the most important work of your career.

About Stripe Publishing

Stripe‚Äôs Publishing team makes books and magazines about economic, social, and technological progress. Our two main brands are Stripe Press, which sold over 300,000 books last year, and Works in Progress, an online magazine. Later this year, Works in Progress will launch a full print magazine with paid subscriptions. Stripe Press will begin selling its entire catalogue of books directly on its website, allowing for more experimentation in pricing, bundling, and reader engagement. While many of the ideas we explore are somewhat timeless, we are very much a startup operation: growing rapidly, experimenting and iterating, and holding high aspirations for what we can build.

What you‚Äôll do

Your primary goal will be to grow the reach of Works in Progress and Stripe Press: a new and highly entrepreneurial role, with no preexisting gameplan. This includes growing Works in Progress‚Äôs audience online, selling Stripe Press books and Works in Progress print subscriptions, and maximising the reach of other outputs like short films and podcasts. You‚Äôll develop and execute a growth strategy across both brands, identifying the right mix of paid and organic tactics, strategic partnerships, and novel channels. Whether it‚Äôs getting mentions in top-tier newsletters, building a high-performing referral program, or running partnerships with conferences, you‚Äôll be responsible for designing what works and delivering results‚Äîwhile upholding and strengthening Stripe Publishing‚Äôs distinctive taste.

Responsibilities

Run growth, partnerships, and marketing for Works‚ÄØin‚ÄØProgress and Stripe‚ÄØPress.Produce and implement a clear growth plan that covers who we want to reach, which channels we‚Äôll use, how much we‚Äôll spend, and how we‚Äôll judge success.Experiment with different channels (events, newsletters, paid ads, podcast appearances, SEO and LLM search, etc.) and optimise spending over time based on whatever proves most effective.Develop and implement a social strategy designed to increase reach and audience share with thoughtful posts in line with our overall taste. Seek out and run partnerships‚Äîsuch as conferences, newsletters, or joint campaigns‚Äîthat put our books and magazines in front of new readers.Run launches and special offers, including price tests, limited‚Äëtime deals, and cross‚Äëpromotions between the magazine and the books.Track results and share updates and lessons after each big push.Maintain basic marketing tooling (email platform, ad pixels, analytics tags) and keep data clean for reliable reporting.Set up renewal and retention efforts, like welcome emails, auto‚Äërenew flows, merch and other perks, to keep subscribers and repeat book buyers.Create a simple referral program so happy readers can share and earn rewards, and track how it performs.Make sure our articles, book excerpts, and interviews rank well in search and keep drawing organic traffic.Prepare and manage the yearly marketing budget, adjusting month by month as results come in.Find, recruit and manage any external contractors or agencies required for all of the above.


Who you are

We need someone who has experience in growing the online audience of media brands that are similar to Works in Progress and Stripe Press, as well as selling things on the internet in creative ways. Experience in the book publishing industry is not essential. But we are open-minded about what the right skillset looks like: someone with experience in marketing and business development for a fast-growing consumer-focused startup may have the right skills and experience, if they know how to apply them here. You should know when to trust your gut and when to look at the data, and be able to lead this workstream by yourself.

We're looking for someone who meets the minimum requirements to be considered for the role. If you meet these requirements, you are encouraged to apply. The preferred qualifications are a bonus, not a requirement.

Minimum Requirements

5+ years experience in a senior growth-focused role for a startup, ideally (but not necessarily) in media, with a strong track record.A strong affinity for Works in Progress and Stripe Press, including a passion for economic growth and technological progress.


Preferred Qualifications

 2+ years working on online growth for a media brand, with a strong track record.


In-office expectations

Office-assigned Stripes in most of our locations are currently expected to spend at least 50% of the time in a given month in their local office or with users. This expectation may vary depending on role, team and location. For example, Stripes in our Bucharest, Romania site have an 80% in-office expectation, and those in Stripe Delivery Center roles in Mexico City, Mexico and Bengaluru, India work 100% from the office. Also, some teams have greater in-office attendance requirements, to appropriately support our users and workflows, which the hiring manager will discuss. This approach helps strike a balance between bringing people together for in-person collaboration and learning from each other, while supporting flexibility when possible.

Pay and benefits

The annual salary range for this role in the primary location is ¬£75,200 - ¬£112,800. This range may change if you are hired in another location. For sales roles, the range provided is the role‚Äôs On Target Earnings (‚ÄúOTE‚Äù) range, meaning that the range includes both the sales commissions/sales bonuses target and annual base salary for the role. This salary range may be inclusive of several career levels at Stripe and will be narrowed during the interview process based on a number of factors, including the candidate‚Äôs experience, qualifications, and specific location. Applicants interested in this role and who are not located in the primary location may request the annual salary range for their location during the interview process.

Specific benefits and details about what compensation is included in the salary range listed above will vary depending on the applicant‚Äôs location and can be discussed in more detail during the interview process. Benefits/additional compensation for this role may include: equity, company bonus or sales commissions/bonuses; retirement plans; health benefits; and wellness stipends.

jobs.title: Head of Marketing
jobs.description:
Quandela is a European scale up that provides photonic quantum computers that are modular, scalable, energy-efficient and accessible both on the cloud and on premise. Our team of 140 employees specialises in the development of both software and hardware solutions for a variety of quantum applications. We offer a wide range of services, from developing the most efficient and brightest single photons sources, to creating algorithms for quantum computers and providing cloud quantum computing solutions. Quandela plays a pivotal role as a strategic partner in the quantum transformation of industrial sectors such as energy, finance, pharmaceuticals, and transportation. Furthermore, we are esteemed collaborators within the academic and research community.  Following a successful ‚Ç¨50 million fundraising in 2023, we are now scaling up our commercial ventures alongside our ongoing research endeavors.  Quandela has been chosen to participate in the French Tech 2030 program, which aims to bolster French companies pioneering groundbreaking innovations.  
As a full-stack quantum computer manufacturer, we are rapidly scaling our international presence and product offerings. To support this growth, we are hiring a Head of Marketing with a strong scientific background and proven experience in marketing complex, technical products.This is a unique opportunity to shape the market positioning of a deep-tech scaleup at the forefront of the quantum revolution.You will be responsible for defining and executing Quandela's global marketing strategy, working at the intersection of product, communications, and sales. 
Your role will be instrumental in turning our technical excellence into market leadership.. You will work closely with the product department to ensure marketing strategies align with product development and roadmaps. Additionally, you will collaborate extensively with the head of corporate communication to maintain brand consistency and maximize communication impact across all channels. You will be responsible for developing and implementing comprehensive marketing strategies that effectively communicate our quantum computing solutions to target markets, drive brand awareness, and support revenue growth objectives. Your technical background combined with marketing expertise will enable you to translate complex quantum technologies into compelling value propositions that resonate with diverse stakeholders. The position of Head of Marketing will rapidly evolve with the organization. 
Key Responsibilities  Strategic Leadership: Develop and execute comprehensive marketing strategies aligned with company objectives and product roadmaps  Cross-functional Collaboration: Serve as the critical link between product development, communications, and sales teams to ensure consistent messaging and go-to-market strategies   Product Marketing: Work directly with the product department to translate technical specifications of our quantum products into clear value propositions for different industry segments and go-to-market strategies for our quantum computing solutions  Go-to-Market Execution: Lead product launches, sales enablement, messaging consistency, and cross-channel campaigns  Content Strategy: Collaborate with the head of corporate communication, research team, quantum applications teams and products teams to direct the creation of high-quality technical marketing materials, white papers, case studies, and digital content that effectively communicate our quantum computing solutions  Market Analysis: Lead research initiatives to identify market trends, competitive landscape, and customer needs in the quantum computing space  Brand Development: Partner with corporate communication to enhance Quandela's position as a thought leader in quantum computing through strategic communication initiatives and to formalize a global communication platform  Event Management: Oversee participation in industry conferences, technical exhibitions, and corporate events to showcase our quantum technology leadership  Channel Marketing: Develop strategies for partner ecosystem growth and enablement  Performance Measurement: Implement metrics and analytics to measure marketing effectiveness and ROI  Reporting: Provide regular updates to the Chief Growth Officer on marketing performance, strategy implementation, and market insights Team management: responsible for building and scaling a well-structured marketing team composed of both permanent staff (junior and senior profiles) and external partners (freelancers). Define resource needs, recruit the right talent, coordinate collaboration between internal and external contributors, and ensure a cohesive team dynamic aligned with the company's strategic objectives. 


Requirements

Required Your engineering background (Physics, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or related technical field) will be imperative to deeply understand Quandela's sophisticated quantum technologies and to conceive innovative, impactful marketing strategies that translate our technical excellence into market success.
Minimum 10+ years of progressive marketing experience, with at least 3 years in leadership roles. Early-career experience as a Product Manager or in a technical function within deep tech, cloud computing, AI, or HPC environments Proven experience in technology marketing, particularly in deep tech, high-performance computing or cloud computing, or related fields.  Proven ability to build and execute marketing strategies for complex, full-stack technical products  Excellent communication skills with the ability to translate complex technical concepts into compelling messaging  Strong project management skills with experience leading cross-functional teams  Data-driven approach to marketing with experience in AI project management, analytics and performance measurement Led a successful initiative to embed AI into marketing operations: launching AI-powered campaigns, automating workflows, or driving smarter targeting through machine learning. Ability to turn innovation into results, and ready to bring that mindset to our next stage of growth.  Preferred Knowledge of B2B marketing in enterprise technology environments Understanding of scientific and research communities' needs and communication preferences International marketing experience Familiarity with the European technology ecosystem 
 Personal Attributes  Strategic thinker with strong business acumen  Comfortable working closely with engineering, research, and product teams to translate technical insights into clear, value-driven messaging Excellent communicator with a talent for simplifying scientific concepts and engaging diverse stakeholders (technical, business, and institutional)Creative problem-solver with a passion for emerging technologies Collaborative leader who excels in cross-functional environments Self-motivated with a hands-on approach and attention to detail Curious mind with enthusiasm for quantum computing and its applications 


Benefits

 Flexible hours and remote working  Profit-sharing and a company savings plan Annual sustainable mobility bonus for eco-friendly transport (e-bike, e-scooter, electric car) Fully covered health insurance (Alan) Referral program  Meal subsidies (Swile)  
If you're driven by challenge and inspired by the future of quantum computing, let's talk.

Our achievements include 10+ major projects that are popular among our clients and successfully operate in Tier 1-3 countries.The company attracts and values highly qualified specialists, which allows us to efficiently build processes and successfully expand our presence in new locations. Join the team that launches new projects in various markets and shapes the future of the iGaming industry.
Responsibilities:Ensuring stable email deliverability: The Email Deliverability Specialist is responsible for ensuring company emails reach the target audience's inbox with the highest possible engagement rates. This involves analyzing infrastructure, managing domain and IP reputations, and implementing long-term deliverability strategies.Advanced diagnostics and strategic analysis: The role requires a thorough audit of technical aspects like SPF, DKIM, DMARC, DNS configurations, and blacklist monitoring.Sender reputation management: Proactively manage the organization‚Äôs sender reputation to prevent blacklisting and minimize spam complaints.Collaboration with marketing teams: Align email strategies with marketing goals and best deliverability practices to increase email efficiency and scale.Compliance with email regulations: Stay updated on email regulations (e.g., GDPR) to ensure all campaigns comply with legal and provider standards.Analysis and reporting: Regularly analyze delivery performance and provide actionable insights for improving engagement and efficiency.
Key Skills and Experience:Minimum of 2 years of experience in email marketing or deliverability.Proven track record of improving email deliverability metrics.Proficiency in CRM platforms (Customer.IO, Sendgrid) and analytics tools (PowerBI, LookerStudio).Practical experience with warm-up tools (Folderly, Warmy) and deliverability testing tools.Strong knowledge of SPF, DKIM, DMARC, and email infrastructure.

Freedom from micromanagement and rigid hierarchies ‚Äì we make decisions quickly, and you can always reach out for advice directly from any team member.100% guaranteed professional development and acquisition of new skills.
